title: Trinity doesn't seem to switch to regular sync after completing fast sync
body:
After catching up with the current head, the `FastChainSyncer._load_and_process_headers` task finished unexpectedly and trinity ended up in what looks like an infinite loop, starting and immediately aborting a sync. 
```

```

@carver When in fast-sync mode, we used to set `BaseHeaderChainSyncer._sync_complete` when it was time to switch to regular-sync mode, but that doesn't seem to happen anymore; that attribute still exists but is not used anywhere. Maybe we need to reintroduce the code that caused `FastChainSyncer` to set that event so that its `_run()` method would return and let `FullNodeSyncer` move on to the state sync?

The current approach is to simply cancel out of the fast syncer:

https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/blob/61b9bfa527a83e59ba215d9da430778f3f9ffbf4/trinity/sync/full/chain.py#L504-L507

There is an outstanding thing I'd like to see fixed, though: when the fast sync *crashes* then state sync starts. Instead it should probably just quit out of trinity.

Some options to resolve that:
1. re-introduce `_sync_complete` and only continue to state sync if it is set
2. add a return value on `service.run()` which acts like an exit code (did it run and shut down cleanly)

I kind of like 2), but haven't dived into it yet.
It seems to correctly switch to regular sync now, so closing
